ARABIC: وَإِذْ قَالَ إِبْرَٰهِيمُ لِأَبِيهِ ءَازَرَ أَتَتَّخِذُ أَصْنَامًا ءَالِهَةً إِنِّىٓ أَرَىٰكَ وَقَوْمَكَ فِى ضَلَٰلٍ مُّبِينٍ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Remember when Ibrahim said to his father, Azar. 'Do you take idols as gods? I see that you and your people are clearly misguided.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Remember when Abraham said to Azar, his father: "Why do you take idols for God? I certainly find you and your people in error."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: And recall when Abraham said to his father, Azar: 'Do you take idols for gods? I see you and your people in obvious error.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Consider when Abraham asked his father, Azar, "Why do you believe idols to be your gods? I find you and your people in absolute error".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And remember when Ibrahim said to his father (paternal uncle) Azar, “What! You appoint idols as Gods? Indeed I find you and your people in open error.” (Prophet Ibrahim was rightly guided since birth).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And (remember) when Ibrahim said to his father Azar: "Do you take idols as gods Verily, I see you and your people in manifest error."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And when Ibrahim said to his sire, Azar: Do you take idols for gods? Surely I see you and your people in manifest error.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And when Abraham said to his father Azar, 'Takest thou idols for gods? I see thee, and thy people, in manifest error.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: (Remember) when Abraham said unto his father Azar: Takest thou idols for gods? Lo! I see thee and thy folk in error manifest.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Remember when Abraham said to his father, Azar, "Do you take idols as your gods? I see that you and your people have clearly gone astray."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And recall what time Ibrahim said unto his father Azar: takest thou idols for gods! Verily I see thee and thy people in error manifest.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: When Abraham said to Azar, his father, ‘Do you take idols for gods? Indeed I see you and your people in manifest error.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Lo! Abraham said to his father Azar: "Takest thou idols for gods? For I see thee and thy people in manifest error."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And (remember) when Ibrahim (Abraham) said to his father Azar: "Do you take idols as aliha (gods)? Verily, I see you and your people in manifest error.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: (And remember) when Abraham said to his father Azar: 'Will you take idols for gods, surely I see you and your people are in clear error'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Abraham said to his father Azar, “Do you take idols for gods? I see that you and your people are in evident error.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Abraham said to his father Azar, "Do you take idols as deities? Indeed, I see you and your people to be in manifest error."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [6:74] And, mention, when Abraham said to his father Āzar, which was his cognomen, his [first] name being Terah (Tārikh): ‘Do you take idols as gods, to worship? (an interrogative meant as a rebuke). I see you and your people, by [this act of] taking them [as gods], in manifest error’, far from the truth.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: ((Remember) when Abraham said unto his father Azar) who was Terah the son of Nahur: (Takest thou idols) do you worship idols (for gods) so many gods: small and large, male and female? (Lo! I see thee) my father (and thy folk in error manifest) in manifest disbelief and wrong in so worshipping idols.
